str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Most gladly, most pleasantly. Neuter plural of the superlative of the same as hedeos; with great pleasure.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To spend, bear expense, waste, squander. From dapane; to expend, i.e. to incur cost, or to waste.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To spend (give out) completely, exhaust. From ek and dapanao; to expend, i.e. exhaust.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Greatly, exceedingly, abundantly, vehemently. Adverb from perissos; superabundantly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
Lesser, inferior, weaker. Neuter of comparative of heka used for that of kakos; worse; by implication, less.
